other_tests.findings: A 6-cm segment of descending colon at the splenic flexure demonstrates asymmetric wall thickening and edema with pronounced pericolonic inflammatory changes. There are scattered diverticula in this region. No extraluminal air or evidence of abscess. A small amount of fluid tracks within the mesentery, particularly along the left abdomen and pelvis, with no pelvic or inguinal lymphadenopathy by size criteria.
